meanings.definition: The process or period of gathering crops.
meanings.sent1: During the harvest, farmers collect ripe fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The harvest in autumn brings in a bounty of fresh produce.
meanings.sent3: At the harvest festival, everyone enjoyed the delicious food.
meanings.sent4: The harvest of knowledge from books is like gathering ripe fruits of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the golden wheat fields ready for harvest was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The result or consequence of an action or process.
meanings.sent1: The successful project was a fruitful harvest of hard work.
meanings.sent2: His kindness towards others resulted in a harvest of friendships.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prank led to a hilarious harvest of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The investment in education yielded a rich harvest of opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The long hours of practice culminated in a satisfying harvest of skills.

meanings.definition: To gather a crop as a harvest.
meanings.sent1: Farmers harvest corn in the summer to sell at the market.
meanings.sent2: They will harvest the apples from the orchard next week.
meanings.sent3: She decided to harvest the ripe tomatoes for a fresh salad.
meanings.sent4: The students will harvest data from their experiments for analysis.
meanings.sent5: It is time to harvest the ripe grapes for making wine.
